items.title: Account Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Account Executive

We are looking for an Account Executive to become an integral part of our expanding start-up business, Property Basecamp.

Property Basecamp began with a simple idea. An idea cultivated by a group of young professionals, a laptop and the desire to create something special. Now it has been defined as a platform that has the potential to disrupt the global employee relocation and property industry, and we want you to join us as we continue our expansion into the UK market.

So what actually is Property Basecamp? Property Basecamp is an enterprise digital application that connects a globally mobile workforce to their home away from home. However, Property Basecamp is about much more than just putting a roof overhead. Our one of a kind PB community platform will enhance your overall living experience by providing you with the ability to foster relationships and build a strong support network, not just with your housemates, neighbours, or people in your city but all over the world. So no matter where you go you will have a friendly face to help you settle in to your new surroundings.

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
Have you ever had to relocate somewhere else in the world for work purposes? Well you know stressful this can be. Why not help reinvent the relocation experience! We are currently seeking candidates who would be interested in helping transferees relocate to London and the surrounding area. The Account executive responsibilities are:

• Work with account managers to build, manage, and grow strategic partnerships with large customers and agencies in the UK market
• Be the main point of contact on client accounts and ensure that our work is aligned with their business goals
• Leverage customer feedback to drive improvements to the products and services that we provide customers.
• Conduct Pre-Arrival consultation with relocating employee. Gather employee specific home search criteria.
• Educate and offer local knowledge and advice to relocating employees on all things London including, but not limited to: neighbourhoods, transportation links, commuting times, local amenities, schools, shopping, recreation and local dining
• Research suitable apartments/rental homes that meet the relocating employees individual and unique needs
• Assist with scheduling property viewings with property agencies and landlords
• Facilitate ‘individual mover’ employees to source potential housemates via PB ‘Buddy-Up’ process
• Full exposure to other departments within the company including Sales, Marketing and Product Development and management
• Strong potential for senior position as we are growing aggressively


This is not an ordinary role in an ordinary company. This is full-on startup mode where you will have the ability and freedom to make decisions in a split second without the need for approval after approval from management. We are extremely ambitious and plan to make ourselves a global brand which will provide you with the opportunity to see the world and grow both personally and professionally. What are you waiting for, take the leap

Underlying Principles when working with Property Basecamp
• Accountability - Are you happy to stand over the work you are doing?
• Provide Value- Provide more value to your colleagues, employees and stakeholders than you ask for
• Communication - transparency with your colleagues and stakeholders
• Respect - respect to your colleagues and stakeholders
• Property Basecamp is about People, not Properties

Property experience is a bonus for this role but not mandatory.

items.title: New Business Development Director
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
We're a decentralised full-stack digital agency specialising in UX/UI, website design & development, and content marketing. located in London, UK.  We have had a very successful year, and are in urgent need of a new talent to join the Starberry Constellation and work with us to develop the next wave of award-winning websites and content marketing.

 

We are looking for a sharp minded Business Development Director based in London, who can work remotely from your home office or co-working space. You will work closely with the founders of the Starberry to help to raise our profile, secure new clients and manage key accounts.  It is an exciting time to join our growing, innovative and creative agency.

 

The role involves working on several accounts as the client partner, managing client expectations and being the key liaison for new relationships.  Your leadership skills and an analytical mindset will drive the business forward proactively managing the sales processes through lead generation, solution pitch, negotiation and closing deals.

 

Awesome stakeholder and relationship skills are needed, both internally working closely with the Project Managers, Creative teams, and with clients stakeholders in order to deliver projects according to plan. Working within a small, close-knit team this role is a key position in the company.

 

The Role:

  • Responsible for owning lead generation, from marketing initiatives through to developing and securing new accounts from industry contacts and networking

  • Present the company to potential clients through direct communications in face-to-face meetings, video conferences, telephone calls and emails

  • Owning and managing the company sales pipeline

  • You will have individual responsibility for new business and are expected to self-manage, however, support will be available from the CEO, and management for larger/more complex pitches, strategies and solutions

  • Representing the company at trade/industry events

  • Interaction with other internal departments

  • Developing sales collateral, credentials across all relevant clients and sectors

  • Keeping up to date with industry news

  • Meeting and reporting on agreed sales targets

 

Skills:

  • Have a real passion and strong background in delivering cutting edge digital solutions, including comms strategies, websites, apps, mobile and content marketing campaigns.

  • Excellent presenting and negotiating skills at board level

  • First class written and verbal communication skills

  • Capable of hands-on problem-solving, with the ability to generate ideas and solutions

  • Good time management and planning

  • Have a creative eye and sound knowledge of the digital media landscape

  • Prior experience in the property sector would be good, but not essential.

  • Prior experience in Account Direction or Account Management in a digital agency is essential.

 

As Starberry is fully decentralised you will work remotely from your home office or co-working space. The role will suit an experienced corporate or consumer all-rounder currently at Senior Account Director level and looking to progress their career. This is a truly exciting post where you can have a real impact on the agency's success.

Visit our Website: https://starberry.tv

If you believe you have what it takes and are ready to propel your career to the next level then this is the role for you, and the sky's the limit.

items.content:
European Happiness Manager

Posted Apr 4

Pathable
Headquarters: Seattle
https://careers.jobscore.com/careers/pathableinc/jobs/european-client-happiness-manager-dLReT8mTKr6k-ReMg-44q7
View all Pathable jobs →

While this is a remote-work position, we are specifically looking for candidates who live in the UK or Western Europe, as the goal is to service our European and APAC clients.

As a Client Happiness Manager, you are the partner and guide for our clients. You’ll master our provisioning and deployment dashboard, you’ll be sweet-talking the important details out of the harried and over-worked event planners that are our customers, preparing and launching the sites, and then providing “best practices” nudges and hand-holding to help them get the most out of the on-line community you built for them. When something goes wrong and a customer calls, hot under the collar, you’re imperturbable. When they finish talking to you, they’re thinking “whew, that’s one less thing I need to worry about!”

We are a software company, which means you should be adept and comfortable with computers, the Internet and the modern way of doing things: you know when to right-click in your browser, you use formulas in Excel, you can tell me why you prefer your mobile device to the one that you don’t have. You know the difference between a text message and a push notification, you check your e-mail somewhat obsessively and you know that sometimes, work has to be done at 1 AM because it has to be done at 1 AM.

You are fun to work with and when a client is difficult to work with, you know how to get your zen on. 
While not a requirement, candidates with sales background will get extra consideration, as we would like the option of making this a split sales / support role.

Apply for this position

Apply through https://careers.jobscore.com/careers/pathableinc/jobs/european-client-happiness-manager-dLReT8mTKr6k-ReMg-44q7- Please do not phone or email. - We do NOT work with recruiters.

items.content:
WordPress Sales Executive

Posted Apr 4

Pressable
Headquarters: San Antonio
https://pressable.com/careers/account-manager/
View all Pressable jobs →

Pressable, a leading provider of WordPress hosting, is looking for driven individuals to join our remote team as a Sales Specialist. This is an outbound sales position. Compensation is salary plus commission. In addition to strong technical sales skills, you’ll need a working knowledge of WordPress to succeed in this role.

This position is salary + bonus, with incredible potential.

Requirements for this role include:

  • Identifying leads using technographic data and other means.
  • Building a pipeline.
  • Travelling to industry events.
  • Being a thought leader, sharing opinions based on customer feedback with our team.
  • Coordinating with team members and leads to get estimates.
  • Working with an Account Manager to ensure that customers are successful and stay with Pressable.
  • Reporting to management and executives on a regular basis.
An Sales Specialist should have the following skills and experiences:

  • Familiar with WordPress and the WordPress Community.
  • Demonstrable success in B2B technical sales. Non-technical salespersons should not apply.
  • A self-starting approach to work.
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, possessing the ability to clearly communicate through text-based chat, video conferencing and phone calls.
Preference will be shown to candidates with experience selling WordPress at a hosting company or digital agency.

We may invite an applicant to complete a limited-time “trial” project as part of the hiring process. A trial is an opportunity for our team to get hands-on experience working with an applicant and evaluating their work. We pay applicants a standard rate of $15/hour while they work as a contractor to complete their trial project.

We ask everyone who applies to be authorized to work in the United States. When you apply, please provide a detailed description of your past experience in technical sales.

Our benefits our great. You can expect:

  • Flexibility. Our team is remote, meaning you can work from anywhere you want as long as you have an internet connection.
  • Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance for less than $10. We pay 99% of premiums for you and your family.
  • 401(k) matching. We match your 401(k) contributions up to 6% of your salary.
  • A generous time off policy. We want our team members to enjoy a phenomenal work–life balance.
  • An annual company retreat.
Let us know you’re interested!

Apply for this position

https://pressable.com/careers/apply/?position=account_manager
